member.name: P:Ice.Lib.AppSettingsHandler.TreeExpandIndicatorThreshold
member.summary: Gets the TreeView expansion indicator threshold.

remarks.para: If there are a large number of child tree nodes than it can take a significant amount of time to determine if each of the child nodes has children or not. This threshold value will determine at what child count checking will not be done. The checking is only done to put a "dummy" tree node under the child node so that there will be an expansion indicator or not on the child node. If there are more than the threshold value, all child nodes will have the dummy node under them.
Defaults to 0 if the value is not numeric or less than zero. Zero implies that the old behavior of checking every node for children is used.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.AppSettingsHandler.GetAppSettingsSettingStringValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the application settings setting string value. This method will first check to see if the setting exists in the user settings section and will return that value if it is found.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.AppSettingsHandler.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the Key exists on either the AppSettings or UserSettings nodes.
member.param: key of the node - case sensitive.
member.returns: true if the Key exists on either the AppSettings or UserSettings nodes

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.AppSettingsHandler.GetString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of a child node in the appSettings or userSettings node. userSettings will be checked first and then appSettings.
member.param: key of the node - case sensitive.
default value if node does not exist.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.AppSettingsHandler.GetString(Ice.Lib.AppSettingsSections,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of child node in a named section.
member.param: Value to use if node does not exist.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.AppSettingsHandler.GetBoolean(Ice.Lib.AppSettingsSections,System.String)
member.summary: If the setting is missing or it cannot be parsed, it returns a null.
member.param: the key or node name in the XML file.
member.returns: the setting value or null if not found or it couldnt be parsed as a boolean.

member.summary: Sets the node/value pair in the appSettings node of the configuration file.

member.name: T:Ice.Lib.EnvironmentInformation
member.summary: Holds environment information.
member.remarks: This class was added to make unit testing easier. The specific issue was that has a static constructor that would through an exception because it couldn't find the configuration file. When you are using the MSTest unit testing framework, you can't specify the command line and therefore the assumes one of the parameters that MSTest uses is the configuration file name and causes an exception.

member.name: P:Ice.Lib.EnvironmentInformation.ConfigurationFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the configuration file.
member.value: The name of the configuration file.
member.remarks: The method forces a specific path for the configuration file no matter how you specify it on the command line. This property allows you to set it before the has initialized it's static data. This value will be ignored after the classes static data has been initialized.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.EnvironmentInformation.GetCommandLineArgs
member.summary: Gets the command line arguments.
member.remarks: If this hasn't been set already with the method, then the is used to get the value.

member.name: M:Ice.Lib.EnvironmentInformation.SetCommandLineArgs(System.String[])
member.summary: Sets the command line arguments.
member.remarks: Since many things rely on these values, you can only set before it is actually used. Once the value is set it cannot be changed.
member.exception: Thrown if the command line arguments have already been set.
Thrown if the parameter is null.
